message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using the World Development Indicators dataset, we explore the relationship between government spending and economic growth in low-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Development Indicators"], "topic": ["Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we combine data from the Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS) and the Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS) to investigate the factors affecting the use of family planning methods in developing countries.", "dataset": ["Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS)", "Demographic and Health Surveys (DHS)"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses panel data from the Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA) and Propensity Score Matching (PSM) techniques to analyze the impact of agricultural extension services on farmers' productivity in Uganda.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Study-Integrated Surveys on Agriculture (LSMS-ISA)"], "topic": ["Agriculture and Food"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze the relationship between deforestation and climate change using data from the Forest Atlas of Cameroon and the Climate Research Unit (CRU) Time Series dataset.", "dataset": ["Forest Atlas of Cameroon", "Climate Research Unit (CRU) Time Series"], "topic": ["Environment", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank Enterprise Survey and the Doing Business Report, we examine how business regulations affect the competitiveness of firms in Latin America.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Survey", "Doing Business Report"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "In this study, we merge data from the World Values Survey and the Afrobarometer to examine the determinants of citizens' trust in public institutions across African countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance"]}, {"sentence": "We combine data from the Human Development Index (HDI) and the Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) to analyze the extent of multidimensional poverty in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Human Development Index (HDI)", "Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI)"], "topic": ["Poverty"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a natural experiment design using data from the India Human Development Survey (IHDS) and the National Family Health Survey (NFHS) to determine the impact of women's empowerment on child nutrition outcomes.", "dataset": ["India Human Development Survey (IHDS)", "National Family Health Survey (NFHS)"], "topic": ["Nutrition", "Gender"]}, {"sentence": "We use data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys and the International Trade Center's Export Potential Map to investigate whether the quality of business environment affects firms' competitiveness in international markets.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys", "International Trade Center's Export Potential Map"], "topic": ["Trade", "Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using data from the International Energy Agency (IEA) and the International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA), we compare the costs of renewable and non-renewable energy sources across different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA)"], "topic": ["Energy"]}]

(HDI) and the Global Multidimensional Poverty Index (MPI) to analyze the extent of multidimensional poverty in sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Human Development Index (HDI)", "Global energy sources across different regions of the world.", "dataset": ["International Energy Agency (IEA)", "International Renewable Energy Agency (IRENA)"], "topic": ["Energy"]}]
